reviews.review: This Videogame changes you. It combine the incredible strength and perfection of an incredible Story, with one of the best gameplay of 2013. I've just finished it. I'm criyng. I fell like everithing has gone to its place, and the game is like a perfect circle without anything to complain about. PERFECT. Buy it, and feel it. Don't play it. Feel it. Taste it. You won't regret it. Best Game of 2013.
Я ни чего не скажу такого как все остальные, но скажу лишь одна, то что мне проста нравится мир "BioShock" меня проста затягивает в него и все!!!
Um bom jogo!

Leverer et koselig miljø, med masse deilig musikk og glede. 

Bortsett fra den creepy fanatismen og generelle clusterfucken oppi det hele.
Eines der BESTEN Spiele allerzeiten. Ist jeden Cent wert!

É fácil cair na tentação de elogiar a Irrational Games por ter ambicionado tão alto, ou, mais apropriadamente, de ter feito um jogo no paraíso. Mas em vez disso vamos dizer o seguinte: o primeiro Bioshock foi um dos melhores jogos desta geração. Em comparação, Infinite parece um salto quântico.

Na superfície existem muitas diferenças entre os dois jogos, mas as semelhanças também são muitas. Ambos decorrem numa utopia, governada com punho de ferro por um líder visionário - e possivelmente louco. Ambos passam-se no passado. Ambos combinam armas de fogo com poderes sobrenaturais. E ambos arrancam com um farol no meio do oceano.

Mas onde Infinite realmente marca a diferença, não apenas do seu antecessor, mas de praticamente todos os FPS do mercado, é na narrativa. É um complicado quebra-cabeças que se revela lentamente, mas com segurança, através de diálogos entre as personagens principais, monólogos dos inimigos, diários de áudio, conversas entre os habitantes do mundo e ainda através do ambiente.

O ano é 1912 e a localização é Columbia, uma cidade que voa pelos céus e que é dominada por uma forte comunidade religiosa, que se despediu da "Sodomia por baixo de nós", porque aparentemente o americano comum é excessivamente pecador e não é patriota que chegue. O auto-proclamado profeta Comstock é quem reina em Columbia, e é adorado como um deus.

Apesar de Booker ser o protagonista jogável, de muitas formas é Elizabeth a verdadeira estrela do jogo. É encantadora, divertida, adorável e de confiança. Vão passar a maioria do tempo com ela enquanto tentam escapar de Columbia. Considerando que qualquer jogo com um foco evidente em companheiros controlados pela IA tem tendência para correr mal, este foi um enorme risco por parte da Irrational.

Mas perseguiram esse objetivo sem olhar para trás e foi uma aposta ganha. Elizabeth é um auxílio, não uma responsabilidade e quando não estiver por perto vão sentir a sua ausência. Nunca fica no caminho e não existe um único momento em que tenham de a proteger. Ela sabe bem tomar conta de si.

A liberdade de escolha em relação ao combate é fantástica. Existem metralhadoras, caçadeiras e espingardas. Depois podem evoluir para a artilharia pesada, com lança-mísseis e granadas. Tudo isto pode ser melhorado com clips de munição maiores, dano extra, carregamentos mais rápidos e outras características semelhantes.


A interação entre armas de fogo e os Vigors é fabulosa e só melhora com o facto dos ambientes realmente encorajarem a um movimento permanente. As Skyways, longos cabos construídos para teleféricos que se estendem pelas inúmeras ilhas flutuantes, podem ser usadas para deslizarem através de um gancho que apanhem logo no início do jogo. Assim podem tentar alcançar uma posição mais vantajosa ou escapar de uma situação perigos. Além disso, muito do equipamento (peças de roupa que fornecem vantagens passivas), oferece bónus à utilização das Skyways. Por exemplo, uma das peças permite o carregamento automático das armas sempre saltam para um cabo e outro oferece invulnerabilidade temporária no momento em que saem de um cabo.

A combinação de excelentes armas com mecânicas de jogo alternativas é uma combinação rara hoje em dia. Infinite até supera o original por não incluir as batalhas de Boss dispensáveis que se tornaram numa das queixas mais frequentes de Bioshock. O único problema é possivelmente o nível de dificuldade algo baixo. Os veteranos de FPS devem experimentar o nível Hard sem grandes receios.

Mas Bioshock Infinite oferece mais do que apenas ação. Columbia é um local vibrante e excitante que esconde uma multitude de segredos e merece ser explorado, e a vossa curiosidade será recompensada com equipamento, dinheiro, diários e melhoramentos. Completámos o jogo duas vezes - a primeira acabou por ser algo apressada, ocupando cerca de oito horas. Na segunda vez explorámos cada cantos e examinámos cada porta fechada. O tempo de jogo aproximou-se mais das 16 horas, o que diz bastante do conteúdo presente em Columbia.

Ao mesmo tempo, o ritmo é quase perfeito. A ação frenética é equilibrada com sequências mais calmas, onde o jogo permite que os jogadores visitem áreas povoadas sem grandes incómodos (a não ser que roubem alguém ou ataquem um guarda). Existe muito para ver e descobrir.

Columbia é um local memorável e deve muito ao grafismo que permite um ambiente estupendo. A iluminação é impressionante, desde os raios de sol que passam pelas nuvens, as velas da catedral criam um efeito magnífico no interior, e o fumo e o fogo que se vislumbra no horizonte é um espetáculo digno. As grandes vistas panorâmicas de estátuas, os espaços abertos, os dirigíveis e os bairros de lata, tudo se conjuga com os detalhes mais pequenos, como as decorações das lojas e os pósteres de propaganda - tudo foi exemplarmente produzido.

O estilo dos personagens é quase caricaturado, o que é provavelmente uma decisão acertada. Os NPC menos importantes e aleatórios não têm o nível de detalhe de Elizabeth, mas os personagens centrais têm todas um aspeto fantástico.
A atmosfera é acentuada com uma trilha sonora complementar. O argumento é excelente e as interpretações dos atores impressionam, seja a ouvir a conversa de um casal ou nos momentos mais marcantes da história. Mesmo assim convém enaltecer o trabalho e a química de Troy Baker e Courtnee Draper, nos papéis respetivos de Booker e Elizabeth.

A trilha sonora também merece um destaque particular, já que suporta convenientemente os momentos mais dramáticos. Até existem algumas músicas que serão estranhamente familiares aos jogadores, mas se alongarmos podemos entrar no território de pormenores da história.

Como já foi referido, Bioshock Infinite pode durar algo entre as oito e as 16 horas de jogo, e recomendo que joguem na dificuldade Hard, para realmente explorarem Columbia como ela merece. Se o fizerem vão encontrar uma experiência que poucos jogos nesta geração podem equiparar. Os gráficos são espantosos, a atmosfera é estupenda e a trilha sonora é soberba. Mais importante, a ação é fantástica e a história marcante. A Irrational Games criou uma obra-prima.

Le variabili in questo gioco non esistono, quindi non ci si deve preoccupare di fare scelte giuste o sbagliate.
Detto ciò la sceneggiatura è davvero unica, lo stile che lo contraddistingue ha portato alla gloria lo steampunk e i collarini per le ragazze, è meglio di un film e vale ogni centesimo del suo prezzo.
Mai un bug, mai uno script fuori posto, anche il doppiaggio italiano è buono, ma lo consiglio fortemente con le voci originali che stanno molto più nella situazione in cui si trovano.
È una storia d'amore che... non posso dirvi niente, vi tocca prendere il mouse e godervi questo capolavoro!
Игра очень однообразная и скучная, её супер восхвалённый сюжет игру никак не спасает от нудных перестрелок в одинаковых локациях.
this is a great game.but but can get a bit hard at times
its a very good game but i  want more vigers

History: 25/10
Gameplay:9/10 (Just 2 weapons, seriously ?)
Soundtrack: 10/10
Graphics 10/10

MUST PLAY

This game is first and foremost Amazing! With a capital A! There is so much that can be said about this game; fluid controls, superb graphics, compelling storyline, detailed beyond detailed. I played through this game three times already and all the DLC content and if you take the time to explore and play on a difficulty that is challenging for you then this game will stick in your imagination for a long long time. The storyline offers philisophical perspectives that give you that "Ahha!" expression as the pieces come together. There really is not anything wrong with this game, which is why it got FPS of the year from a number of award circuts. The combat and mechanics is so well refined that it compelles creativity in battle and makes you beg for more. If there is one other game you play in your life it needs to be this game!

After the DLC was released I played through the Bioshock series again and the DLC does a really nice job at tying everything together.

This is my favorite game of all time! the story is amazing, the characters are very memorable, and the combat is cool. I can't tell you how many times i beat this game, but one thing I can tell you is that eveery time I play it I feel like I'm playing it for the first time over and over again and even though I know everything that happens it still manages to entertain me Best game ever!

This is among the best stories I have ever experienced. It took me a little while to get over the railroaded nature and uninspired gunplay, but once I did I didn't care about it anymore. The story was incredibly engaging and I really felt intersted and immersed in the game. I had fun and it moreover made me think.
If you want a mystery rapped in an enigma with action from beginning to end with suspense as well then this is the game for you!

Where to begin?
This was by far my favourite BioShock game. Hands down. I've always been a fan of a game with a great story line.  With BSI I found the story quite compelling.  With the first two games I found that the reason I wanted to play the game was because I enjoyed the environment a lot and not necessarily just the story. I've gotta tell you, the story in BSI had me more or less right from the minute I climbed out of the boat.  Then you get to columbia... Loved it. So now, I'm taken by this bad ass environment (that looks spectacular on Ultra btw) and the story.  I could write a really long review.  But honestly, just stfu and play it yourself. If you like a game with a great story, like Spec Ops: The Line, any of the Half LIfe games, or fallout 3. Play this. Take the weekend, sit down, and play it.  Then play 1999 mode.

This game is amazing. Elizabeth is, without a doubt( and without equal), the single greatest sidekick in any game ever, of all time:P The only thing holding back this game in any way (which it really isn't held back) is too much combat. With so much exploring, story, and eye candy the fighting seems to just get in the way of the player's endeavor to figure out more story. Thats not to say that the combat isnt fun. It is. Its just annoying when you are so drawn into the storyline. 

I think, I hope, that this game will inspire other developers to take over the reigns and try to embark back into Myst style games where puzzles and storyline take priority over holding down buttons until everything is dead.
I was so busy being pulled in by the captivating story and gorgeous scenery that I almost forgot that this was also a pretty fun shooter. Best game I've played in 2 years. HIGHLY recommended.
Great game!

Il finale.
.
What an amazing story and the graphics are really 2nd to none (imho). Although you are pretty much hand-guided through the game, the ride is totally worth the ticket price.

Amazing story, flawless game mechanics,... an FPS you can't miss to play.

Very well balanced gameplay, stunning scenarios from the very beggining up to the end of the game.

Be sure that by playing the first BioShock,  you will appreciate the better the plot of this story.

[i] BioShock Infinite has a great story and gameplay, but what's exactly BioShock Infinite? [/i]

[h1] Overview: [/h1]
In the story line, your main character will be Booker DeWitt a private detective with a simple task to find a girl (Elizabeth) in the flying city of Columbia.
The story takes place in 1912 in a a flying city called Columbia that is amazing, fascinating, full of colors and with a beautiful living hella atmospheric world.

[i] "When I first seen Columbia, that sky was the brightest, bluest sky that there ever was. Seemed like Heaven. Then your eyes adjusted to the light, and you see that sea of white faces looking hard back at you." [/i]

[h1] Fighting/guns [/h1]
Main part of the game is focused on violence and shooting. First you'll get your hands on the Sky-Hook, which is useful both in combat and when moving around the flying city, and then firearms like the pistol, sniper rifle, shotgun, machine gun and the awesome hand cannon. Weapons and abilities (vigors) can be upgraded. Sky-Hook's can completely change your play style as you shoot and move around Skylines to the other side of the battlefield. This makes combat definitively 3D.

[h1] Vigors [/h1]
In the previous Bioshock games we had plasmids in the BioShock Infinite you'll have vigors. Vigors are of various kinds, such as lightning, fire, etc.

[h1] Elizabeth [/h1]
I've already mentioned Elizabeth, who has the most beautiful eyes in the world and will help you in combat when you're looking for ammo or medical supplies and believe it or not, that will help you a lot in combat. She can also open space-time rifts.
Elizabeth the girl you will fall in love with, the girl who will stand by your side throughout the whole story.

[spoiler] "Bring us the girl, and wipe away the debt." [/spoiler]

[h1] Overall [/h1]
Anyone who has played the previous games in this series will understand that the shooting style is good, but it's best when the story is involved. An amazing shooter with a fascinating story and the amazing Elizabeth, who is the most sympathetic character in the virtual world ever.

[spoiler] "Booker, are you afraid of God? 
No. But I'm afraid of you." [/spoiler]
If you didn`t play this game. Then fuckin do it. Buy in the next Sale or something!!!!
Збс.

Gotten tired of these games that are so dark and always are played in dark enviroments. There's darkness and grayness enough when I look outside my window so I really appreciated the new "atmosphere" and colorful enviroment of the game. The normal difficulty level might be a tad too easy for almost everyone so I'd recommend setting it a bit higher. Anyway, it was a real fun experience and a emotional rollercoaster throughout the game. I've been rarely captured by a games story as Bioshock Infinite but most of the interest and the love comes from the last moments of the game and instead of thinking "I finished", you think "What now? Need to know more".  

I probably spent more time reading about the story than I actually played the game, I wish it would've been quite a bit longer but but we can't have everything. Recommend this wholeheartedly.
this game is facking awsome

У BioShock: Infinite есть всё, чем можно поразить всех до единого. Окружение, по сравнению с первой частью, разнообразное: от ярких, кипящих жизнью городов до тёмных безжизненных, разрушенных местностей. Я не буду говорить о геймплее, так как вся серия BioShock (под "серией" я имею в виду BioShock и Bioshock: Infinite) направлена именно на сюжет, а геймплей стоит где-то на 3-ем или 4-ом месте. Чтобы ничего не спойлернуть о сюжете, скажу сразу, что он настолько запутанный, а концовка настолько неожиданна, что только ради этого надо играть в BioShock Infinite!

Had loads of fun with this game. Everything is beautifully crafted, especially the set designs that come in a huge variety but all remain fresh and equally interesting. As with the original Bioshock, the intricate presentation of social themes and ideologies are an important part of the overarching design, and Bioshock Infinite is no different. They are gripping and clearly presented, while refraining from distracting the player from the main narrative. The story, while confusing and even overbearing at times, is intriguing, reaching a fascinating crescendo during the last 20 minutes of the game.

The game is by no means 'perfect', but the clear amount of affection and care that has been put into every small detail in all of its many, many different components results in something that is thoroughly remarkable and enjoyable. It's a game that should be respected, and more importantly enjoyed, for a sum of all its parts.

Это шедевр! Определённо игра года! Незабываемая атмосфера, грамотно продуманный сюжет, красивая и яркая графика и затягивающий с головой геймплей, и самое главное не забываемая главная героиня. 
Элизабет - Девушка одна из лучших во всей игровой индустрии! Она всячески будет помогать вам в прохождении, то есть доставать аптечки, соли, патроны, открывать разрывы и многое др. Эмоциональная, красивая и живая девушка, которую вы полюбите ещё с первой встречи с ней и это огромный плюс!
Покупайте, играйте и наслаждайтесь!

The story is by far one of the best in a while.  Not many games throw as much action into a storyline that really makes you stop and think at times.  I recommend this game just on this much alone, throw in the fact the game is crazy long and has lots of secrets to discover and theres not much that can go wrong.  The only downside is really you switch guns a lot, which makes no sense in why they let you upgrade guns if your constantly switching out the good ones for one with bulllets.  But hey thats why they give ya a hook, to smack people when ya can't decide what gun to pick up!
incredible
The ending of this game made my jaw drop. The visuals are stunning and it is well worth the purchase. It is a great addition to one of my favorite game series.

This game is simply amazing. I highly recomend this to anyone who is just in for a good story, because irratonal games has brought their very best with this one. The only negative thing i think i could ever say about this game would probably be that the combat portions seem like your typical FPS game but the story motivates you more than enough to push through lengthy sections.

História intrigante e envolvente, com uma incrível atenção aos detalhes e uma qualidade gráfica que enche os olhos. Apenas acho que alguns detalhes poderiam ter sido bem mais explorados - aerotrilhos mais extensos deixariam o jogo bem mais dinâmico, e menos "shoot 'n cover". Fora isso, a jogabilidade é muito boa e o final é de fazer o jogador "queimar os miolos". Definitivamente um dos melhores jogos que eu tive a oportunidade de comprar e jogar.

I really liked the music, setting and art, and the intro sequence was very well done.

The ending felt somewhat poor and overcomplicated with respect to the rest of the game, probably suffering from a plot that opens quite a bit of loose ends. 

All in all, the game is fun, full of nice touches, a good story, extraordinary setting, music, voice acting and art. A++ would play again!
nice game
This totally messed with my brien. Was a really great game, but unfortunately, I didn't get much replay value from it. Great pick up on sale though.

結論から言うとおもしろいし万人にお勧めできるゲームだと思います。
ですが、値段の割にボリューム不足が感じられ、DLC第1弾の14ドルは制作者の誠実さを疑います。

このゲームのすばらしさは他のレビューで書かれているので不満な点を。
いろいろ面白い要素やギミックが詰め込まれているのですが、詰め込んだだけでまとまっていないので散漫な印象を受ける。
伏線が投げっぱなしでそもそも回収しようとする意図があったのか？複雑なストーリーなので色々考察されていますが、
細かい伏線が明らかに放置されており、そう考えると本筋もプレイヤーに考察の余地を残したというより破綻しかけたものを力業で押し通しただけではと疑ってしまう。
で、体験版レベルのDLC。第2弾がDLC1と同程度のボリュームだと話をまとめるのはたぶん期待できないだろうなぁ。
クリア後、冷静に考えると「前回までは海底だから今回は空を舞台にしよう」で止まってしまったゲームという印象が残った。

この後、DLCを消化するためRAGEをやったが意外と楽しめた。たぶん太陽輝く天空の城より、暗くてじめじめして、ほこりっぽい舞台が好きなんだと思う。
DLCの値段も良心的だし。

Devo ammettere di essere rimasto incredibilmente sorpreso da questo gioco, in senso positivo. Comprandolo ero stato messo in guardia sul fatto che questo era probabilmente il più banale e commerciale dei tre titoli intitolati Bioshock, essendo di fatto il terzo episodio della serie. Niente di più errato! Certamente cambiando l'ambientazione e trasferendo la storia su Columbia cambia anche l'atmosfera prevalente, percui si nota sin da subito che gli ambienti non sono più quelli tetri e oscuri di Rapture (anche se con il tempo il paesaggio muta sensibilmente e comunque non mancano certo le citazioni ai precedenti episodi). L'elemento distopico rimane predominante e la trama non manca certo di spessore, mantenendo il giocatore col fiato sospeso fino all'ultimo secondo di gioco. In particolare a mio giudizio di grande effetto è il finale nel quale viene spiegato il complicato intereccio della trama, dimostrando che quest'ultima non è solamente un pretesto per creare un FPS. Consiglio questo gioco a tutti, non solo a coloro che hanno apprezzato i primi due titoli di Bioshock, ma anche agli appassionati del genere Avventura e degli FPS, ne vale veramente la pena!
I LIKE DIS

Having played this game on console first, and then PC, I must say it is a true masterpiece. This game is fantastic in every respect. Graphics are phenomenal (the beautiful use of color is eye candy), gameplay is smooth and addicting, and the story is insanely gripping and will make you prone to attachment. If you haven't already played this game, then you are making a huge mistake. Definitely among the best games I've ever played, if not the best. 10/10!

Overall not a bad game. THe story is better than anything. I enjoyed the game overall, but don't recommend it as a shooter, more as a story-driven game.

Beautiful graphics, amazing storyline with extremely intense gameplay. Recommended for all!

Mit Bioshock Infinite hat der Entwickler Irrational Games wieder ein Meisterwerk abgeliefert. Während sich die Vorgänger Bioshock 1 und 2 bereits durch eine sehr gute Story und atemberaubendes Setting auszeichneten, setzt Bioshock Infinite diesem noch das i-Tüpfelchen auf.
Die Spielwelt ist grandios in Szene gesetzt. Ich musste unzählige Male einfach stehen bleiben und mir das Bild bestaunen, welches sich mir bot. Auf der Suche nach einem Mädchen, taucht der Spieler in die Story ein, ist bezaubert von der fliegenden Stadt Columbia und seinen Bewohnern. Allgegenwärtig ist dabei die Macht eines Mannes Namens Comstock. Dieser regiert die Stadt, der gottgleich und allgegenwärtig zu sein scheint und immer als der "Prophet" bezeichnet wird. Der Einstieg ins Spiel wirft dem Spieler zunächst viele Fragen auf. Wenig wird zu Beginn erklärt. Doch mit der Zeit setzen sich alle Puzzelteile zusammen und ergeben eine extrem gute Story, wie ich sie selten erlebt habe in einem Spiel, das bis zuletzt hochspannend bleibt. Das Ende ist nicht ganz trivial und einfach zu verstehen, jedoch nicht weniger grandios. Wer hier noch offene Fragen hat kann sich die ein oder andere Erklärung bei Youtube ansehen.
Das Gamesplay ist sehr gut umgesetzt. Die verschiedenen Kräfte machen Spaß und die Steuerung (vor allem an den Skylines) ist exzelent umgesetzt. Vor allem der Fakt sich nicht um den Schutz seiner Begleiterin zu bemühen, ist ein großes Plus des Spiels. Jegliche Interaktion geht schnell und intuitiv von der Hand. Die Variationen an Gegnern ist ausgewogen, das Design originell.
Die Gesamte Spielwelt bietet von Level zu Level sehr viel Abwechslung. Was heiter und sonnig beginnt, scheint zum Ende in einen Alptraum zu gipfeln. Das Thema Religion spielt in Bioshock Infinfite eine ganz Zentale Rolle. Die Allegorien zu echten Religionen sind unübersehbar und gewollt. Sie regen zum Nachdenken an und zeigen im Verlaufs des Spiels, was passiert, wenn solche Ideologien Missbraucht werden.

Mein Fazit:
Ein MUSS für jeden Gamer
That, my friend, is what I call: A Masterpiece.

Это очень хорошая игра с неповторимой атмосферой и захватывающим сюжетом.

Примечательно, что не нужно знать о чем были первые две части, чтобы начать играть в эту.

Рекомендую к прохождению.

P.S. Игру проходил при помощи геймпада, сидя на уютном диване. Сложилось впечатление, что я смотрю длинный и очень захватывающий фильм =)
This is amazeballs. Amazing immersive story that will hurt your brainmind with its ending. Gameplay is more or less exactly like the other Bioshock games which is not a bad thing.

Follow the adventures of Booker Dewitt, a man with a really nicely stencilled front door, as he goes on vodka-fuelled murdering rampage through the streets of Columbia mowing down everybody in his path. Interested? You should be.
Following a brief (and really not very illuminating) introduction, Booker gets sent up to the lovely flying city of Columbia in a jet-powered lighthouse. Get hyped. Having lit some candles and crossed himself in front of a big statue of a man with a beard, Booker narrowly avoids being drowned by a psychopathic priest and the game begins properly.
The flying city of Columbia is a fantastic setting, the seemingly tranquil lifestyle of its citizens at odds with the frenetic run'n'gun action that comes later. Skylines, airships, and vast deserted halls make for spectacular shoot-outs, and it's interesting to note how the sunny floating city becomes a rain-lashed nightmare of destruction as its secrets are revealed.
As you might expect, the initial "press v to mince somebody's face into a lasagne" gameplay evolves into a fantastic combat system over the 15 hours or so that the main story will probably take you, with a multitude of weapons, powers, and the ability to rip holes in the fabric of reality to wreak havoc upon your enemies. That said, it's almost a shame that you'll almost never use the vast majority of your weapons or powers. It's pretty easy to shred your way through the game using only a carbine, machine gun, and sniper rifle, and the much-hyped Vigors often feel like novelties. That said, what's not to like about abilities called "Devil's Kiss", "Bucking Bronco", and "Murder of Crows?"
The plot of the game is enjoyable and never feels tacked onto the gameplay, the two instead complementing each other wonderfully. Although the pace dropped a little towards the endgame (it also ran like a three-legged tortoise with asthama during this bit), the different settings of Columbia that you progress through never feel gimmicky. 
Food, booze, and mysterious potions are key features of the game as it's imperative to keep your health and salts (manna) stocked up as a firefight could be just around the corner. Thankfully, every building in Columbia contains approximately three million trashcans, lockers, desks, and cabinets bursting with food, cash, and health kits. The cash comes in useful when upgrading your weapons and vigors at one of Columbia's automated vending machines. Also, you can go to a pub and, at the cost of most of your salts, get completly wasted, prompting Elizabeth, your [strike] snarky over-emotional bitch [/strike] useful companion to make a [strike] useless and bitchy [/strike] hilarious remark. 
Buy it and remember - don't be a dimwit.
Close to perfection.
FPSです。今回のスローリーはかなり難解ですが、面白いです。おすすめ
One of the best games I have ever played. Fun, fast paced combat, and an amazing story. Plus one of the only NPC's in video games that you will misss when they aren't around.

Even though I only paid €10 for it I don't think it was worth it.
I found the story shallow and patronising, a story written to appeal to the socially and politically illiterate.
The game dynamic just doesn't challenge, there is effectively unlimited ammo and unlimited life, just plow on through the endless weak enemies to get another cut scenes of the tedious story.
I honestly believe that anyone who thinks this story is good probably hasn't read a book (try Jules Vernes 20,000 leagues under the sea from 1870 - now thats a good story)
I would recommend Metro 2033 if you want a nice rail shooter with a good story, plus this can be picked up for less than €5
отличная игра, советую поиграть всем!

This game. 11/10. This masterpiece instantly grabs you by the nips and takes you on a wild, crazy and beautiful adventure, never letting up, only to set you back into reality leaving you to wonder what's real and what isn't.
By far one of the best games I have played.

“El juego es excelente y espectacular en todo sentido. Su jugabilidad es impresionante no es un simple fps, es mucho más que eso. Su historia es impactante, sus gráficos son buenísimos al igual que su temática... La verdad es altamente recomendable, lo tienen que probar les aseguro que les va a encantar... No es un tipo de juego que se ve siempre. Es sin duda una obra maestra.”
9/10

This was the first Bioshock i played to completion and its made me WANT to play the others, its a linear experience but the gun play is great, the story is phenomonal and the characters are really interesting, there's plenty of collectibles about the world that expand the story further and offer some replayability. I cant praise the writers of this game enough, they really made a fantastic storyline for this game, i was completely immersed. Shame the next Bioshock will be made by another developer :(.

9/10

The graphical assets this game has to offer is stunningly pretty. The floating city of Columbia, as impossible as it seems (although not actually impossible), is probably one of my favourite game environments. It's full of things to look at: A change from many other shooters around.


As you have probably heard, graphics are not all this game has to offer. All over the internet, people have been talking about the game's rich story. Yes, it does have a rich story, however, the majority of it is easily missed or ignored. You have to purposely hunt for information in this game if you are to know as much as possible.
The game's characters are mostly interesting. Especially the Luteece 'couple'. Loved those two. I wished for more of them as I progressed.

The DLC to the game is a little short. It didn't take long at all to finish Burial At Sea, episode 1. I'm hoping Episode 2 is a little longer. It added an interesting twist to Bioshock 1+2, however.

This game will make you wish you had never played it to the end - it is just too addicting to stop.  The gameplay is exciting and original, while keeping the feel of the Bioshock style.

Tragically beautiful.

A Real "Mindfuck" 

I Love it!
Very entertaining on the first playthrough, but makes so much more sense the second time through.

I do wish there was a third option taking the middle road between recommending and decrying a game as this title would have earned it.

I am exceedingly fond of the world created in Bioshock and Bioshock II, I find the art style fantastic, the art deco aesthetic is pulled of in detail and the world is engagingly complex.

In infinite however the complexity is all gone so while it is beautiful and visually enjoyable the mechanics are lacking. It feels dumbed down due to console constraints and few things irk me as much as that. This is not saying that the previous titles didn't have heacy tendencies toward console simplification too but it has been kicked up another couple of notches and that is depressing. The game is still worth it for the story and the visuals but only once and the DLC to date is severely lacking.

I was positively drooling to get to revisit an unspoiled rapture but the story so far is short, weak and only very shortly set in an uncorrupted setting. I would have loved for this to approach the playstyle complexity of the original Deus Ex but instead it heads straight to irrelevance. I will recommend it but only when it is on sale.

In essence this is not your uncles RPG / FPS crossover, infact it is neither FPS nor RPG it is a 3D graphical novel with a limited combat model that feels slow clunky and incomplete. It is also beautiful and enjoyable for a straight playthrough but no more than that.
Incredible story but mediocre gameplay.
